text: Lumber size, grade, species, and treatment per approved submittals
Moisture content checked for compliance (≤19% for dimensional lumber)
No damaged, split, or bowed members used
Fasteners and connectors (nails, screws, hangers) per spec and load tables
Floor sheeting nailed properly
Holes in floor patched
Joists do not obstruct plumbing/drainage
Mid-span blocking installed at proper centers
Bearing posts installed where needed
Deck sheeting properly fastened
Deck slope checked and correct
Deck hangers nailed, lag bolts installed, soft backing installed
All walls properly nailed and shimmed
All walls checked for plumb
Wing walls are plumb and secure
Shear walls patched and filled if required
Drywall backing installed (≤2” variance)
Wing walls are plumb and secure
Blocking installed (fire, bearing, squash)
ROs (Rough Openings) measured and plumb
Door plates flush cut and nailed/pinned
Braces, blocks, and loose nails removed
Floor/wall connections patched and secure
Drywall installed behind exterior studs
Beams nailed per plan
Hangers filled with nails as specified
Hurricane clips installed on all trusses
Joist/plate gaps filled properly
Columns square and plumb
Poly installed at exterior/concrete joints
Insulation installed in dead spaces
Plumbing walls installed after LPD (drywall)
Bathroom/tub framed per measurements
Drywall backing installed at all angles and corners
Trusses and rafters installed per truss layout and shop drawings
Bracing and ties installed to resist uplift/lateral movement
Roof sheathing fastened and aligned per structural specs
All connectors and fasteners inspected
Rough framing verified against architectural and structural dimensions
Debris and framing garbage neatly piled for removal
QA/QC and consultant review completed prior to MEP rough-in, cladding, and insulation

id: • NBC Part 9 – Housing and Small Buildings
• CSA O86 – Engineering Design in Wood
